conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the transparent object for the monochromatic light.
The semi-cylindrical object has a radius R. The light enters at point C, which is at a distance of \( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R \) from the center O.
The angle of incidence \( \theta_i \) is the angle between the incident ray and the normal at point C.
No light is emitted from the right side, indicating total internal reflection.
The critical angle \( \theta_c \) is the angle of incidence at which total internal reflection occurs.
Using \( \sin \theta_c = \frac{1}{n} \), solve for the refractive index: \( n = \sqrt{3} \).
The refractive index of the transparent object for this monochromatic light is \( \sqrt{3} \).
Draw a line from C perpendicular to the base of the cylinder. The light ray travels from C towards the right, hitting the boundary at the critical angle.
The ray undergoes total internal reflection and does not emerge from the right side.
